ðŸŒŸ ScrollSnap | Swift
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Capturing and stitching scrolling screenshots on macOS.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Customizable Selection Area â€¢ Scrolling Capture â€¢ Interactive Menu â€¢ Thumbnail Preview â€¢ Save Destinations
ðŸ“– Summary: ScrollSnap is a macOS application designed for capturing long, scrolling screenshots. It allows users to define a custom selection area, automatically stitches multiple screenshots together, and provides an interactive menu for capture, save, and reset options. The application offers a thumbnail preview and supports saving to various destinations, including the Desktop, Clipboard, and Preview.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ codecafe | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Real-time collaborative code editing for pair programming, teaching, and building web projects together.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Pixel-Perfect Live Preview â€¢ True Real-Time Collaboration via Operational Transformation â€¢ VS Code Feel with Monaco Editor â€¢ Zero Setup, browser-based
ðŸ“– Summary: CodeCafÃ© is a real-time collaborative code editor designed for seamless, browser-based coding. It features live previews, operational transformation for conflict-free simultaneous editing, and a VS Code-like experience through the Monaco Editor. The platform requires zero setup, enabling instant collaboration for pair programming, teaching, and building web projects.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ Hyprland | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: A highly customizable, dynamic tiling Wayland compositor for Linux desktops.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Highly customizable â€¢ Dynamic tiling â€¢ Wayland compositor â€¢ Eyecandy (gradient borders, blur, animations, shadows) â€¢ Plugin support
ðŸ“– Summary: Hyprland is a dynamic tiling Wayland compositor written in C++ that prioritizes customization and visual appeal. It offers a range of features including gradient borders, blur, animations, plugin support, and dynamic workspaces. Hyprland aims to provide a modern and efficient desktop experience with a focus on flexibility and performance.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ pdf-craft | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Converting scanned PDF books into Markdown or EPUB formats, particularly for books and documents requiring OCR and semantic structuring.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ PDF to Markdown conversion â€¢ PDF to EPUB conversion with LLM enhancement â€¢ Text extraction from scanned books â€¢ Header, footer, footnote, and page number removal â€¢ Reading order determination
ðŸ“– Summary: PDF Craft is a Python library designed for converting PDF files, especially scanned books, into other formats like Markdown and EPUB. It utilizes OCR, layout analysis, and optionally LLMs to extract text, remove irrelevant elements, determine reading order, correct errors, and structure the content for improved readability and semantic coherence.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ PairDrop | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Transferring files between devices on a local network or over the internet, regardless of the operating system.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Cross-platform file sharing â€¢ Local network and internet transfers â€¢ Persistent device pairing â€¢ Temporary public rooms for file sharing
ðŸ“– Summary: PairDrop is a web-based application for cross-platform file sharing, inspired by AirDrop and forked from Snapdrop. It allows users to transfer files between devices on the same local network or over the internet using paired devices or temporary public rooms. Key features include persistent device pairing, an improved UI, and the ability to send files directly from share menus, context menus, or the command line.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ logocreator | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Generating professional logos quickly and easily using AI.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI-powered logo generation â€¢ Customizable logo styles â€¢ Open-source implementation â€¢ Rate limiting â€¢ User authentication
ðŸ“– Summary: The logocreator repository provides an open-source AI-powered logo generator. It allows users to create professional logos in seconds with customizable styles. The application uses Flux Pro on Together AI for logo generation, Next.js with TypeScript for the app framework, and integrates with services like Upstash Redis, Clerk, and Plausible for rate limiting, authentication, and analytics.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ background-removal-js | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Efficient and cost-effective background removal directly in the browser or Node.js for e-commerce, image editing, and web-based graphic design tools.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Background removal in the browser â€¢ Background removal in Node.js â€¢ Cost-effective solution â€¢ Data privacy
ðŸ“– Summary: @imgly/background-removal is an npm package that allows developers to seamlessly remove backgrounds from images directly in the browser or Node.js. It offers a cost-effective solution without compromising data privacy, making it ideal for e-commerce, image editing, and web-based graphic design applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
